alert.note: Alert for Chattooga (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:51AM EST until January 10 at 5:10PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattooga River at Summerville affecting Chattooga County. For the Chattooga River...including Summerville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast to occur. * WHERE...Chattooga River at Summerville. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, significant flooding expands further into the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 27 or Rome Boulevard. In Trion... portions of the parking lot by the river at Mount Vernon Mills... Second Street near the levee...and athletic fields off Dalton Street are flooded with a foot of water. Also near Lyerly... portions of Lyerly Dam Road near the river are flooded with around one foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 18.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 3.9 feet and begin rising again Thursday morning. It will rise to 4.3 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EST.
